intro: Delissea albilineata, commonly known as the white-line fern, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its striking, white-veined leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in a spadix, surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. Delissea albilineata thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Its ornamental value has made it a popular choice for indoor gardening and botanical collections.
